article:
Edith Cavell was born in a little English village. She was a clever, _ girl and did well at school, especially in music and _ . After she left school, her first job was to take care of the children of a _ family in Belgium. The language they spoke was French, _ she found that her school studies were useful. She could understand them  _ , at the same time she taught the children to speak English and play the piano.
After _ that her father was seriously ill, Edith returned home to look after him. She then decided to become a nurse. _ she worked for five years in an English hospital where she was good at her job. A Belgian doctor was so impressed that he invited her to his country to _ a training school for nurses. The _ World War broke out in 1914 and Edith Cavell's school of nursing became a hospital. She _ there to look after the sick and wounded soldiers. Edith treated them _ kindness. Between November 1914 and August 1915 she helped about 200 wounded soldiers and prisoners   escape from the Germans. Later the German army found out _ Edith had done and they arrested her. Finally, the Germans _ her, but they could not kill her memory. A _ statue has been built in Trafalgar Square, London, in honor of the _ English nurse.
